result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelvin T Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *  Pay the mandatory DNA fee only. All other costs are waived due to the Defendant being indigent.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / par time employment and or schooling.
*  Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms or weapons during the pendency of the probationary period.
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelvin T Ross

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work, treatment, and child care.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR with the follow conditions of probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay the mandatory DNA fee only. All other costs are waived due to the Defendant being indigent.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / par time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Community service of 100 hours.
*  Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms or weapons during the pendency of the probationary period.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Kelvin T Ross in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUTN 1:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kelvin T Ross in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kelvin T Ross in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense requests an adjourned date. Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kelvin T Ross not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant's appearance waived. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, Defendant Kelvin T Ross not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced form Waukesha County for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kelvin T Ross not in court, in custody. Morgan Wilz appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date. Case adjourned to branch 23.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kelvin T Ross not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kelvin T Ross
Current: 4330 N 84TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 07-09-2015)
Prior: 2403 Springdale Road #6A, Waukesha, WI 53186

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kelvin T Ross in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Kelvin T Ross in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
